meta-title: Relational Mathematics – Four Pillars of Numerical Order
classic-text-1: In classical arithmetic, congruences are remainders. But is the remainder everything?
classic-text-2: Instead of value — think of rhythm. Instead of number — think of cycle.
elimination-text-1: Numbers are not chosen — they are unremoved. What remains after interference is what survives.
elimination-text-2: It is not construction. It is purification.
structure-text-1: Value does not exist. Relation does. Each S creates its own rhythm, and U defines only the cognitive scale.
structure-text-2: When rhythms do not eliminate — a prime number emerges.
tools-text-1: Explore the elimination simulation code within the S^S·U space.
